body_html:
@snownus NodeNameFromInput just simply strip :1 at the end of input name, so that the control input would have a correct name. (tf doesn't allow :x in control input name)

For you second question, I have saw it once, cause by an empty tensor. Quantize need min < max, and for an empty tensor x, min(x) = inf and max(x) = -inf, which will break the constraint. I solve it by modify the tf kernel. I am not 100% sure that your problem cause by the same reason as mine, but hope those information helps you.

For you second question, I have saw it once, cause by an empty tensor. Quantize need min < max, and for an empty tensor x, min(x) = inf and max(x) = -inf, which will break the constraint. I solve it by modify the tf kernel. I am not 100% sure that your problem cause by the same reason as mine, but hope those information helps you.
body:
@snownus `NodeNameFromInput` just simply strip `:1` at the end of input name, so that the control input would have a correct name. (tf doesn't allow `:x` in control input name)

For you second question, I have saw it once, cause by an empty tensor. `Quantize` need `min < max`, and for an empty tensor `x`, `min(x) = inf` and `max(x) = -inf`, which will break the constraint. I solve it by modify the tf kernel. I am not 100% sure that your problem cause by the same reason as mine, but hope those information helps you.
